section.name: Welcome to Apache Harmony - Open Source Java SE

p.big: Welcome to Apache Harmony - Open Source Java SE.

section.p: Apache Harmony is the Java SE project of the Apache Software Foundation. Please help us make this a world class, certified implementation of the Java Platform Standard Edition!
The aim of the project is to produce a large and healthy community of those interested in runtime platforms tasked with creation of :

ul.li: A compatible, independent implementation of the Java SE 5 JDK under the Apache License v2
A community-developed modular runtime (VM and class library) architecture.

section.p: We aim to support wide range of different platforms. The main criteria for whether a particular platform is supported or not is the involvement of people in running tests on regular base, reporting build status, finding and fixing bugs for that platform, and so on. We have a list of platforms we are actively maintaining at the moment.
Please see the following "Getting Started" guides :

ul.li: Getting Started for Harmony Users : for those that wish to use pre-built snapshots of Apache Harmony
Getting Started for Harmony Contributors : for those that wish to checkout and build the source of Apache Harmony.

section.name: Project Status
section.p: How are we doing? We're making steady progress :

ol.li: JRE can run popular programs like Apache Tomcat, Eclipse, Maven, Derby, Ant
More than 95% of Java 5 API complete. (not compatible, just completed)
More than 1.25 Million Lines of Code

p.blockquote: Apache Harmony now has a JDK snapshot available, that includes javac, keytool, and others. While not complete, it's our first step towards the standard JDK distribution format expected by developers. For more information, please see our downloads page. (2006-12-27)
We now are including support for the x86-64 architecture under Linux. For more information, please see our downloads page. (2006-12-14)

p.strong: Apache Harmony: Top-Level Project of the Apache Software Foundation
p.blockquote: Apache Harmony is now a top-level project of the Apache Software Foundation. On October 25th, the Board of Directors voted to make Apache Harmony a top-level project, and on October 29th the Apache Incubator PMC voted to graduate Harmony from the Apache Incubator, having satisfied the Incubator's requirements for community governance and IP oversight. We're in the process of transitioning our resources and infrastructure over, so please be patient while we do our move. (2006-10-29)
